de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class MaterialDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Dialog
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialog
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractHeaderDialog
          • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractAnimateableDialog
            • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractValidateableDialog
              • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractButtonBarDialog
                • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractListDialog
                  • de.mrapp.android.dialog.MaterialDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, AnimateableDialog, AnimateableDialogDecorator, ButtonBarDialog, ButtonBarDialogDecorator, Dialog, HeaderDialog, HeaderDialogDecorator, ListDialog, ListDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator, ValidateableDialog, ValidateableDialogDecorator

    public class MaterialDialog
extends AbstractListDialog
    A dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices. Such a dialog consists of a title, a message and up to three buttons. Furthermore, the dialog can be used to show list items. It is possible to customize the color of the dialog's title and button texts and the title as well as the dialog's content can be replaced with a custom view. For creating or showing such dialogs, the methods MaterialDialog#create() or MaterialDialog#show() of the builder MaterialDialog.Builder can be used.
    Since:
    3.0.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaterialDialog

        protected MaterialDialog(@NonNull
                         android.content.Context context,
                         @StyleRes
                         int themeResourceId)
        Creates a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme
